content:
ere circumstances in which matters of welfare become so urgent
that the rights of the fetus (assuming the fetus has rights) are overridden?
The obvious case in which this might happen is when the life of the bearer
of the fetus is plainly threatened. For many conservatives on abortion,
abortion is permitted in such cases. Some who hold a pro-choice position
will maintain that severe psychological, financial, or personal losses to the
pregnant woman may also take precedence over the life of the f
